label: 太政官
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: composed of ministers and counselors who advised the throne, carried out the royal will, and after 701 managed eight ministries charged with conducting ritsuryō governance. Institutional and political historians trace the Council's development from Tenji's age onward. By Nara times there were periods when considerable tension developed between the throne and the Council, especially over royal succession. [律令、天智]
